variants.Description in input context: This variant is predicted to cause a minor conformational change in the protein.

Material used.Description: Neuro-2a cells were transfected with plasmids expressing either wild-type or mutant SYN1.

Readout description.Result Description: Western blot analysis showed a ~30% reduction in protein expression in cells transfected with the mutant SYN1 construct compared to wild-type, demonstrating a potential disruption in protein stability.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent transfections were performed for each condition.

Technical replicates.Description: Each blot was probed with three different antibodies for confirmation.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SYN1 plasmid was used as a positive control to verify expression.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection served as a negative control to rule out any non-specific signals.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used to analyze differences in protein expression.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression between 80% and 120% of the control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression less than 80% or greater than 120% of the control.
